OpenMath is an extensible standard for representing the semantics of mathematical objects.

http://openmath.github.io

Home
About
News , Follow & Contact us   
Edit this page

Follow and contact us

Follow us on the net and social media

To get the latest news on OpenMath in a timely manner:

  • Add our Atom Feed to your feed reader.
  • Follow @openmath on Twitter.
  • Follow our development on GitHub.
  • Live chat with us on Gitter (we also have a private room).

Follow us with our two open mailing lists

  • Opendreamkit news: news@opendreamkit.org
  • Community discussions: community@opendreamkit.org

Contacts

  • To get in touch: contact@opendreamkit.org
  • Participants: participants@opendreamkit.org
  • Coordinator: coordinator@opendreamkit.org
  • Coordination team: coordination@opendreamkit.org
  • Steering committee: steering@opendreamkit.org
  • Advisory board: advisory@opendreamkit.org
  • Administration: admin@opendreamkit.org

Press releases

  • 18 Jun 2015, CNRS Projet européen sur les logiciels libres de mathématiques
  • 01 Jul 2015, University of St Andrews, EU open source software project gets the green light
  • 02 Jul 2015, University of Southampton, EU Open source software project receives green light
  • 05 Jul 2015, University of Oxford
  • October 2015: the German interest group “Fachgruppe Computer Algebra” published an article about the OpenDreamKit project in issue 57 of its journal
  • 05 Oct 2015, University of Paris Saclay: OpenDreamKit, un programme européen, ancré à Paris-Sud. Rencontre avec Nicolas Thiéry et Viviane Pons
